pr_title: FLEX-5395 Add configuration of IP addresses that may be duplicated

timeline.message:
FLEX-5395 ~ Adds configuration of IP addresses that may be duplicated

Upon device registration, the IP address of the registered device is
removed in the database for other devices where it is configured (with
the exception of the loopback address - localhost / 127.0.0.1).

These changes allow to either configure that such clean up should never
be performed (allowing multiple devices to share any network address),
or to configure a comma separated list of IP addresses or IP address
ranges that may be shared (for instance
"192.168.0.1,192.168.1.12-192.168.2.103" to allow sharing of 192.168.0.1
or any IP address from 192.168.1.12 to 192.168.2.103 inclusive).

timeline.bodyText: A bit strange to put this in setUp, while it is overridden in a lot of tests
timeline.author: robindenadel

replies.bodyText: I changed the way the setup is handled, so this default before-each that is hardly ever used is no longer applied.
replies.author: bvdzwet

timeline.bodyText: You could consider making constants of these variables, since they are used in almost every test
timeline.author: robindenadel

replies.bodyText: I changed the way the host and InetAddress are configured in the tests, making some use of constants. In general I don't think we should be too eager to extract as much as possible from test code, as this can make the separate tests harder to understand looking at them in isolation, without tracing other parts of the code. I hope you are OK with the balance I tried to find here.
replies.author: bvdzwet

timeline.message:
FLEX-5395 ~ Only allows 127.0.0.1 as duplicate network address

By default only allow 127.0.0.1 to be used as network address with
multiple registered devices simultaneously. Allowing all loopback
addresses (127.*.*.*) to have duplicates caused some Cucumber test
depending on network address cleanup for other loopback addresses to
fail.
It is still possible by changing configuration to allow IP addresses to
be shared between devices for all addresses or for specific ranges.

Addresses some review comments about the setup in the test code, where
setup with before-each was overridden in most test cases, and some
specific values were used in most of the tests.

Simplified code for InetAddress in DeviceRegistrationMessageService.
InetAddress.getByName("127.0.0.1") works just fine, while
InetAddress.getLoopbackAddress() could return other values than
127.0.0.1 according to its documentation (even though the current
implementation does return 127.0.0.1).
